alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 24 at 3:53AM ChST until December 25 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...North and east facing reefs. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM Saturday for north facing reefs. For the High Rip Current Risk, through 6 AM Saturday for north facing reefs and through Sunday night for east facing reefs. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large northeast swell is expected to peak tonight before shifting more easterly Saturday. This will allow the rip risk and hazardous surf to fall below 9 feet along north facing reefs. A high rip current risk is expected to persist along east facing reefs through the weekend.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
